revised_title: Eruption of Vesuvius in 1834: Geological Observations and Chemical Analysis
tldr: This article describes the eruption of Vesuvius in August 1834, based on the manuscript notes of Cavaliere Monticelli and other sources. The author, Charles Daubeny, provides a detailed account of the event, including the lava flow, devastation, and the chemical composition of the gases and vapors emitted during the eruption. The study helps to understand the behavior of the volcano and its impact on the surrounding environment.
